page.title: 19LANGUAGE IN NEWRY.
page.content: Newry has many colourful local sayings A scourge= an annoying person Blow in= a stranger come to live here Corny= out of date Newry nyuck= a local person Gutties= running shoes Scallions= spring onions Our fellow= my brother Our ones= my family Lonan= country lane "Flicks"= cinema Slim= potato bread Shuck= a trench Champ= mashed potato and spring onion Is the tea wet= is the tea made The cribben= the edge of the footpath I'm dosed= I have a bad cold Your eyes are bigger than your belly= you are greedy Like looking for holy water in the Orange Hall= impossible to find Thick as a ditch= stupid.
